title: American_Top_40_1974_November_23rd
description:
"Let me remind you that Thanksgiving is only a few days away and less than a month after that we hit the big 

double-holiday of Christmas and New Years with our special countdown of the 100 biggest selling songs of 1974."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a 

rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

There is a song by a Canadian quartet whose lead singer faked a speech impediment because he couldn't hold a 

musical note very long and still sound good.

Neil Sedaka is on the chart for the first time in eight years.

The Pointer Sisters are at number 26 with their son, "Fairytale" which went on to win them Best Country Vocal 

Performance by a Duo or Group for the year 1974.

There is a song in the countdown by the man who has had more double-sided hits than anyone else before or since. 

By this date he had 51 double-sided hits.

A listener noticed that there have been 5 Canadian artists who have hit number one so far in 1974 and wants to 

know if that made 1974 a record year for Canadians hitting number one on the American charts. Casey gives the 

answer and all the details.

40:    Willie And 4:37 The Hand Jive - Eric Clapton
39:    Let's Straighten It Out - Latimore
38:    Must Of Got Lost - J. Geils Band        
37:    Woman To Woman - Shirley Brown     
36:    Three Ring Circus - Blue Magic     
35:    Fire Baby, I'm On Fire - Andy Kim    
34:    You Ain't Seen Nothing Yet - Bachman-Turner Overdrive

32:    Laughter In The Rain - Neil Sedaka
31:    Love Don't Love Nobody Part 1 - The Spinners
30:    La La Peace Sone - Al Wilson
29:    I Feel A Song (In My Heart) - Gladys Knight & The Pips     
28:    Junior's Farm - Paul McCartney & Wings
27:    You're The First, The Last, My Everything - Barry White
26:    Fairytale - The Pointer Sisters
25:    Touch Me - Fancy

22:    People Gotta Move - Gino Vanelli

15:    Wishing You Were Here - Chicago
